thread.title: Mississippi's Renasant to buy Georgia bank for $59M in stock
thread.title_full: Mississippi's Renasant to buy Georgia bank for $59M in stock - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Mississippi's Renasant to buy Georgia bank for $59M in stock
text:
JACKSON, Miss. (AP) - Mississippi-based regional bank Renasant Corp. will acquire Georgia-based KeyWorth Bank for $59 million in stock.
The banks announced the merger Tuesday, just after Tupelo-based Renasant announced its quarterly earnings.
The merger will bulk up the presence of Renasant, based in Tupelo, in Atlanta's affluent northern suburbs. Renasant has been gobbling up other banks, acquiring seven in the last 11 years.
KeyWorth, based in Johns Creek, Georgia, has $389 million in assets. Renasant says the merger would give it $8.2 billion in assets and 175 offices in Mississippi, Alabama, Tennessee, Georgia and Florida.
The banks say they hope to complete the merger before March, pending approval by KeyWorth shareholders and regulators. Two top KeyWorth managers are supposed to remain.
Renasant says the acquisition would boost profits immediately.
This story has been corrected to show that KeyWorth is based in Johns Creek, Georgia, not Heritage.
